Cover and shake until well chilled."},{"recipe_directions":"Place large ice cube into the rocks glass and set a small fine sieve over the glass. recipe_card: Pear Galette with Ginger 1 Rating
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 refrigerated pie crust"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon all-purpose flour, divided"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 or 4 red pears, cored and thinly sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon lemon juice"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/4 cup light brown sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon cornstarch"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/4 teaspoon ground ginger"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pinch salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons unsalted butter, cut into small pieces"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 large egg, beaten"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons pear or lemon curd"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons bourbon (optional)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons minced candied ginger, or to taste"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line a sheet pan with parchment paper. Sprinkle about 1/2 tablespoon flour in the center of the pan."},{"recipe_directions":"Following manufacturer’s instructions, bring refrigerated pie crust to room temperature."},{"recipe_directions":"In a medium mixing bowl, toss pear slices with lemon juice. In a small bowl, combine brown sugar, cornstarch, ground ginger, and salt. Sprinkle dry ingredients over pear slices and toss to coat."},{"recipe_directions":"Unroll pie crust and place in the center of the prepared pan. Sprinkle remaining flour over crust, and roll into a 12-inch circle."},{"recipe_directions":"Beginning 2 inches from the edge of the pie crust, arrange pears on the dough in a pleasing design all the way around. Stack any extra slices in the center. Dot with butter, and drizzle any remaining juices in the bowl over the sliced pears."},{"recipe_directions":"Fold the edges of the crust over pears, making a pleat every few inches, as necessary. If the pleats don’t want to hold, lightly moisten with wet fingertips. Lightly brush crust with beaten egg."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the center of the preheated oven until crust is brown and pears are bubbly, 35 to 40 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Remove galette from the oven. Stir pear or lemon curd together with bourbon in a microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on High until mixture bubbles, about 1 minute. Brush mixture over pear filling. Sprinkle candied ginger over all."},{"recipe_directions":"Using the parchment paper, slide the galette onto a cooling rack and allow to cool completely."},{"recipe_directions":"When ready to serve, use parchment paper to transfer to a serving dish or cutting board, then hold the galette in place and slide the parchment paper out. Cut into 8 wedges and serve."},{"recipe_directions":"If you prefer to make your own crust, use a recipe for a single pie crust, such as this Butter Flaky Pie Crust."},{"recipe_directions":""},{"recipe_directions":"If you prefer not to include the bourbon, use 1 tablespoon of water or lemon juice, instead."}]
